<@U02AJEYF538> would you ever consider working with a content writing agency? I run <http://theblogsmith.com|theblogsmith.com>. Please shoot me an email if you'd like to chat more about your needs and how we work with agencies and different brand voices.

Definitely second <@U02EA5937MM>'s test assignment approach. We do two rounds of tests before hiring new writers, progressively upping the stakes and level of detail.

I've personally had luck with the r/HireAWriter subreddit combined with a very intentional/transparent job description and a thoughtful application process.

I also do a version of what <@U024K88ECFN> does — assign super low priority content pieces for clients. I also sometimes use tests to get some content started for my company's blog. :slightly_smiling_face: Sometimes, I'll have a few people do the same test with different details (like splitting up a list of WordPress plugins across a common theme) and frankenstein the best of the tests together (this makes judging tests a much easier apples-to-apples process).
